intro: Heterochroa desertorum, commonly known as the desert starwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is adapted to harsh desert conditions, featuring small, narrow leaves that reduce water loss through transpiration. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Heterochroa desertorum plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
